section.section: In this subsection, "unit" includes each State department, agency, unit, and program, including each clerk of court and each register of wills.
At least once every 3 years, the Office of Legislative Audits shall conduct a fiscal/compliance audit of each unit of the State government, except for units in the Legislative Branch.
In determining the audit schedule for a unit, the Office of Legislative Audits shall take into consideration:
Each agency or program may be audited separately or as part of a larger organizational unit of State government.

Performance audits or financial statement audits shall be conducted when authorized by the Legislative Auditor, when directed by the Joint Audit Committee or the Executive Director, or when otherwise required by law.

In addition to the audits required under paragraph (2) of this subsection, the Office of Legislative Audits may conduct a review when the objectives of the work to be performed can be satisfactorily fulfilled without conducting an audit as prescribed in § 2-1221 of this subtitle.

If, on request of the Comptroller, the Joint Audit Committee so directs, the Office of Legislative Audits shall audit or review a claim that has been presented to the Comptroller for payment of an expenditure or disbursement and that is alleged to have been made by or for an officer or unit of the State government.

The Office of Legislative Audits shall conduct an audit or review to determine the accuracy of information about or procedures of a unit of the State government, as directed by the Joint Audit Committee or the Executive Director.

text.section: If the General Assembly, by resolution, or the Joint Audit Committee so directs, the Office of Legislative Audits shall conduct an audit or review of a corporation or association to which the General Assembly has appropriated money or that has received funds from an appropriation from the State Treasury.
The Office of Legislative Audits may audit any county officer or unit that collects State taxes.

section.section:
The Office of Legislative Audits shall review any audit report prepared under the authority of:
Article 19, § 40 of the Code, with respect to a county, municipal corporation, or taxing district; or
§ 16-315 of the Education Article, with respect to a community college.
The results of any review made by the Office of Legislative Audits under paragraph (1) of this subsection shall be reported as provided in § 2-1224 of this subtitle.

At least once every 6 years, the Office of Legislative Audits shall conduct an audit of each local school system to evaluate the effectiveness and efficiency of the financial management practices of the local school system.
The audits may be performed concurrently or separately.
The Office of Legislative Audits shall provide information regarding the audit process to the local school system before the audit is conducted.

At least once every 3 years, the Office of Legislative Audits shall conduct a performance audit of the Board of Liquor License Commissioners for Baltimore City to evaluate the effectiveness and efficiency of the management practices of the Board and of the economy with which the Board uses resources.
The performance audit shall focus on operations relating to liquor inspections, licensing, disciplinary procedures, and management oversight.
